channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Stock Indexes Try to Balance Trump Tariff Threats, AI Enthusiasm
item.description: The S&P 500 edged higher. The Nasdaq Composite slipped, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average advanced. President Trump told business leaders to make...

item.title: Netflix shares soar as company reports surging revenue, tops 300 million subscribers
item.description: The fourth quarter was the last for which Netflix will report quarterly paid subscriber counts.

item.title: EA shares drop 7% after company lowers guidance due to weakness in soccer, other games
item.description: Electronic Arts slashed its full-year guidance on Wednesday, blaming the shortfall on underperforming games, in particular, its soccer franchise.

item.title: SK Hynix profit soars to a record high on AI boom, but shares drop on demand uncertainty
item.description: SK Hynix CFO Kim Woohyun said that the outlook for memory demand in 2025 was clouded by inventory adjustments, protective trade policies and geopoliti...

item.title: Dollar Likely to Remain Firm in Near Term
item.description: The WSJ dollar index was little changed and was seen likely to remain elevated in the first half of the year before gradually falling.

item.title: EA shares plunge 19%, on track for worst day since dot-com bubble
item.description: Electronic Arts shares plummeted on Thursday after the video game publisher cut its forecast, due largely to challenges with its soccer franchise.

item.title: Gold Futures Slip But Stay Close to Highs on Safe-Haven Demand
item.description: Gold futures fall, though they sit higher on-week on safe-haven demand. Futures are down 0.3% at $2,763.50 a troy ounce.

item.title: Behind MicroStrategy's Bitcoin Bet: Investors Who Usually Play It Safe
item.description: “Bitcoin bonds” offer insurers a less risky way to purchase cryptocurrency.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Inventories Fall Less Than Expected
item.description: U.S. natural gas supplies fell by 223 billion cubic feet last week to 2,892 billion cubic feet, reducing surplus inventories.

item.title: American Airlines shares tumble as outlook falls short
item.description: American forecast a wider than expected loss for the first quarter, sending shares lower.
